translation: all cognition, the adornment of dharmas, and the first attainment

translation: The arising of craving and the eight cities, and the two anāruddhas

translation: The view that views, arrows, and metaphors are proportionately the most inferior

source_sentence: 例品第四(有十一經)(第五後誦)（二一二）中阿含例品一切智經第一我聞如是：一時，
translation: At one time, the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

source_sentence: 佛遊欝頭隨若，在普棘刺林。
translation: The Buddha traveled to Vaiśravaṇa and stayed at Puṣkarasārin’s Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，拘薩羅王波斯匿，聞沙門瞿曇遊欝頭隨若，在普棘刺林，拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，
translation: It was then that King Prasenajit of Kośinagara heard that the renunciant Gotama, who was staying at Kaṇṭhakavyūha in the Puṣkarasārin’s Mango Grove. Having heard this, King Prasenajit of Kośinagara

source_sentence: 告一人曰：「汝往詣沙門瞿曇所，為我問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，
translation: He said to one of them, “Go to see the śramaṇa Gautama and pay my respects to him. The holy bhikṣu will be healthy and strong; he will be comfortable and free from ailment.

source_sentence: 氣力如常耶？
translation: Is the energy as usual?

source_sentence: 作如是語：『拘薩羅王波斯匿問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？』
translation: He said, 'Is the king of Kośala Prasenajit inquiring about the noble person's well-being and strength, whether he's comfortable and without illness, whether his energy is as usual?'

source_sentence: 又復語曰：『拘薩羅王波斯匿欲來相見。』」
translation: Again, he said, 'The king of Kośala Prasenajit wants to see you.'

source_sentence: 彼人受教，往詣佛所，共相問訊，却坐一面，白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: Having been instructed, they went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings. They withdrew to sit at one side and said:

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？
translation: Does King Prasenajit of Kośala inquire about the holy man’s well-being? Is he healthy and strong? Is he comfortable and free from ailments?

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿欲來相見。」
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit wants to see each other.

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「今拘薩羅王波斯匿安隱快樂，今天及人、阿修羅、揵塔和、羅剎及餘若干身安隱快樂。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, Now that King Prasenajit of Kośala is peaceful and happy, today as well as humans, asuras, asuras, gandharvas, rāṣṭrapālas, and other bodies are peaceful and happy.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿若欲來者，自可隨意。」
translation: If the king of Kośala Prasenajit wants to come, he can do so as he wishes.

source_sentence: 彼時，使人聞佛所說，善受持誦，即從坐起，繞三匝而去。
translation: Having heard what the Buddha taught, the bhikṣus listened to it and remembered it well. They rose from their seats, circumambulated him three times, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者阿難住世尊後，執拂侍佛。
translation: At the time, Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Bhagavān, holding a whisk in his hand to attend the Buddha.

source_sentence: 使人去後，於是世尊迴顧告曰：「阿難！
translation: After the messenger departed, the Bhagavān then looked back and told him, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝來共詣東向大屋，開窓閉戶，住彼密處。
translation: Go together to the great house facing east, open its windows and doors, and dwell in that secret place.

source_sentence: 今日拘薩羅王波斯匿一心無亂，欲聽受法。」
translation: Today, King Prasenajit of Kośala is unified in his mind and wants to hear the Dharma.

source_sentence: 尊者阿難白曰：「唯然。」
translation: Venerable Ānanda said, Yes.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊將尊者阿難至彼東向大屋，開窓閉戶，密處布座，敷尼師檀，
translation: Then the World-honored One led Venerable Ānanda eastward, facing toward the great house. He opened the windows and shut the doors, arranged his seat in a hidden place, and spread out his sitting mat [for him].

source_sentence: 結跏趺坐。
translation: He sat cross-legged.

source_sentence: 彼時，使人還詣拘薩羅王波斯匿所，白曰：「天王！
translation: The messenger then returned to the king of Kośala Prasenajit and said, Your majesty!

source_sentence: 我已通沙門瞿曇！
translation: I've already explained it to the ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇今待天王，唯願天王自當知時。」
translation: The ascetic Gautama now waits for the king of gods, but may the king of gods know for themselves when he does so.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿告御者曰：「汝可嚴駕，我今欲往見沙門瞿曇。」
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit told the charioteer, You may prepare your carriage; now I want to go and see the ascetic Gautama.

source_sentence: 御者受教，即便嚴駕。
translation: The charioteer, having received the instruction, immediately prepared his carriage.

source_sentence: 爾時，賢及月姉妹與拘薩羅王波斯匿共坐食時，聞今日拘薩羅王波斯匿當往見佛，
translation: It was then that the good man and the moon sisters, together with King Prasenajit of Kośinagara, heard that today King Prasenajit of Kośinagara was going to see the Buddha.

source_sentence: 白曰：「大王！
translation: He said, Great king!

source_sentence: 若今往見世尊者，願為我等稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，
translation: “O World-honored One, if you are now coming to see the World-honored One, may your holiness pay his respects to us by bowing down one’s head at the feet of the World-honored One and greet him. The holy one will be strong and healthy, without any illness or ailment.

source_sentence: 氣力如常耶？
translation: Is the energy as usual?

source_sentence: 作如是語：『賢及月姉妹稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，
translation: They said, Good men and moon sisters bowed their heads in respect to the World-honored One and greeted him. The holy one’s body was healthy and strong; he was peaceful and free from ailment. He stood up and took his seat at ease.

source_sentence: 氣力如常耶？』」
translation: Is the energy as usual?'

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿為賢及月姉妹默然而受。
translation: The king of Kośala, Prasenajit, the good and moon sisters, accepted it quietly.

source_sentence: 彼時，御者嚴駕已訖，白曰：「天王！
translation: The royal attendant then completed his carriage and said, Your majesty!

source_sentence: 嚴駕已辦，隨天王意。」
translation: The carriage of adornment has been prepared, according to the king of gods' wishes.

source_sentence: 時，王聞已，即便乘車，從欝頭隨若出，往至普棘刺林。
translation: When the king heard this, he immediately rode out of the carriage and proceeded to the bramble-headed forest wherever he wished.

source_sentence: 爾時，普棘刺林門外眾多比丘露地經行，拘薩羅王波斯匿往詣諸比丘所，
translation: It was then that the king of Kośala Prasenajit approached the monks, who were walking on the open ground outside the gates of the potamed forest.

source_sentence: 問曰：「諸賢！
translation: He asked, Good men!

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇今在何處？
translation: Where is the śramaṇa Gautama now?

source_sentence: 我欲往見。」
translation: I want to go and see him.

source_sentence: 諸比丘答曰：「大王！
translation: The monks replied, Great king!

source_sentence: 彼東向大屋開窓閉戶，世尊在中，大王欲見者，可詣彼屋，在外住已，
translation: The World-honored One was staying there. If you wish to see him, the great king may go to that house and live outside.

source_sentence: 謦欬敲戶，世尊聞者，必為開戶。」
translation: If he knocks on the door, the Bhagavān who hears it will surely open the door for him.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿即便下車，眷屬圍繞，步往至彼東向大屋，到已住外，
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit then dismounted from his chariot and, surrounded by his retainers, proceeded on foot toward the great house to the east. Having arrived there, he stayed outside.

source_sentence: 謦欬敲戶，世尊聞已，即為開戶，拘薩羅王波斯匿便入彼屋，前詣佛所，
translation: Hearing this, the World-honored One immediately opened the door for him. Then King Prasenajit of Kośinagara entered that house and came before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: He said, Gautama!

source_sentence: 賢及月姉妹稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？」
translation: Bhagavān and the moon sisters bowed their heads to the Bhagavān, inquiring whether the noble person's body is healthy and strong, whether he's comfortable and without illness, whether his energy is as usual when he rises and lives lightly?

source_sentence: 世尊問王：「賢及月姉妹更無人使耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān asked the king, Good men and moon sisters, isn't there another messenger?

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: King Prasenajit of Kośala said, Gautama!

source_sentence: 當知今日賢及月姉妹我共坐食，聞我今當欲往見佛，便白曰：『大王！
translation: You should know that today Bhadra and the moon sisters are eating together with me. When they heard that I was about to go see the Buddha, they said:

source_sentence: 若往見佛者，當為我等稽首世尊！
translation: If you go to see the Buddha, bow down for us, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？』
translation: He asked, 'Is the noble body healthy and strong, peaceful and without illness, rising up and staying at ease, and has its energy as usual?'

source_sentence: 故如是白世尊：『賢及月姉妹稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，
translation: That is why they said to the World-honored One in this way: Good men and mokṣa sisters, venerating the World-honored One by bowing their heads at his feet, greeted the holy bhikṣu. He was healthy and strong; he was peaceful and free from ailment.

source_sentence: 氣力如常耶？』
translation: Is the energy as usual?'

source_sentence: 瞿曇！
translation: “O Gautama!

source_sentence: 彼賢及月稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？」
translation: That good man and the moon bowed his head to the Bhagavān, inquiring whether the noble person's body is healthy and strong, peaceful and without illness, rising and dwelling at ease, and has the energy as usual?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, Great king!

source_sentence: 今賢及月姉妹安隱快樂，今天及人、阿修羅、揵塔和、羅剎及餘若干身安隱快樂。」
translation: Now, good men and moon sisters are peaceful and happy, and today they're peaceful and happy for humans, asuras, titans, stūpas, rājas, and other bodies.

source_sentence: 於是，拘薩羅王波斯匿與佛共相問訊，却坐一面，白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit and the Buddha exchanged greetings, withdrew to one side, and said, Gautama!

source_sentence: 我欲有所問，聽乃敢陳？」
translation: I want to ask a question, so why would I dare to say it?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Great king!

source_sentence: 欲問者，恣意所問。」
translation: Those who want to ask questions are asked at will.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿便問曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit then asked, Gautama!

source_sentence: 我聞沙門瞿曇作如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一切知、一切見者。』
translation: I've heard the ascetic Gautama say, 'They were nonexistent in the past, will not exist in the future, and won't exist now either; if there are other ascetics or priests who know everything and see everything.'

source_sentence: 瞿曇！
translation: “O Gautama!

source_sentence: 憶如是說耶？」
translation: Do you remember this teaching?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, Great king!

source_sentence: 我不憶作如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一切知、一切見者。』」
translation: I don't recall saying, 'There was none in the past, there won't be none, nor will there be none in the present, if there are any other ascetics or priests who know and see everything.'

source_sentence: 爾時，鞞留羅大將住在拘薩羅王波斯匿後，執拂拂王，於是拘薩羅王波斯匿迴顧告鞞留羅大將曰：「前日王共大眾坐，
translation: At that time, the general of Uruḍa was staying behind the king Prasenajit of Kośinagara and holding a fly whisk in his hand. Then King Prasenajit of Kośinagara looked back and said to the general of Uruḍa:

source_sentence: 誰最前說沙門瞿曇作如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一切知、一切見者。』」
translation: Who was the first to say this to the ascetic Gautama, saying, 'There were none in the past, they won't exist, nor will there be none in the present, and if there are any other ascetics or priests who know all and see all.'

source_sentence: 鞞留羅大將答曰：「天王！
translation: The general of Kālôdayin answered, King of gods!

source_sentence: 有想年少吉祥子前作是說。」
translation: That's what the youngest auspicious boy with ideation said in front of him.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，告一人曰：「汝往至想年少吉祥子所，作如是語：『拘薩羅王波斯匿呼汝！』」
translation: After hearing this, King Prasenajit of Kośinagara told one person, Go to the youngest auspicious boy in Saṃdhi and say, 'King Prasenajit of Kośinagara calls you!'

source_sentence: 彼人受教，即往想年少吉祥子所，作如是語：「年少！
translation: That person receives the teaching, goes to the young auspicious boy's place and says, Young man!

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿呼汝。」
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit calls you.

source_sentence: 彼人去後。
translation: After that person's departure, he said.

source_sentence: 於是，拘薩羅王波斯匿白世尊曰：「沙門瞿曇！
translation: Thereupon, the king of Kośala Prasenajit said to the Bhagavān, Ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 頗有異說異受？
translation: Could it be that there are different explanations of different feelings?

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇憶所說耶？」
translation: Does the ascetic Gautama remember what he teaches?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, Great king!

source_sentence: 我憶曾如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一時知一切，
translation: World-Honored One, I recall one time when I said in the same way: If there were none in the past, there would not be nonexistence. There are none in the present as well.

source_sentence: 一時見一切。』
translation: I'll see all of them at once.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 我憶如是說也。」
translation: I remember such a teaching.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，歎曰：「沙門瞿曇所說如師，沙門瞿曇所說如善師。
translation: Having heard this, the king of Kośala Prasenajit exclaimed in admiration, saying: What the renunciant Gotama teaches is as his teacher; what the renunciant Gotama teaches is as a good teacher.

source_sentence: 欲更有所問，聽我問耶？」
translation: Do you want to ask me anything else, and listen to my questions?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Great king!

source_sentence: 欲問，恣意所問。」
translation: Those who want to ask questions are asked at will.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿問曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit asked, Gautama!

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，為有勝如、有差別耶？」
translation: Are there four kinds of these, and are there the kṣatriyas, priests, householders, and artisans who have superiority or distinctions?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，此有勝如、有差別也。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, These are four kinds: the kṣatriyas, brahmins, householders, and artisans have superiority and distinctions here.

source_sentence: 剎利、梵志種，此於人間為最上德，居士、工師種，此於人間為下德也。
translation: The kṣatriyas and brāhmaṇas are the highest virtues among the people, while the laymen and craftsmen are the lowest virtues among the people.

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，是謂勝如、是謂差別。」
translation: These are four kinds, which are called superior and which are called distinctions among the wardens, priests, householders, and artisans.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，歎曰：「沙門瞿曇所說如師，沙門瞿曇所說如善師。」
translation: After hearing this, King Prasenajit of Kośala praised it, saying, What the ascetic Gautama teaches is like a teacher, and what the ascetic Gautama teaches is like a good teacher.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: King Prasenajit of Kośala said, Gautama!

source_sentence: 我不但問於現世義，亦復欲問於後世義，聽我問耶？」
translation: Not only do I ask about the meaning of the present life but also want to ask about the meaning of the afterlife, so can you hear me ask?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Great king!

source_sentence: 欲問，恣意所問。」
translation: Those who want to ask questions are asked at will.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿問曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit asked, Gautama!

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，此有勝如、有差別於後世耶？」
translation: Are there four kinds of these, the kṣatriyas, priests, householders, and artisans, which are superior and different from those in later generations?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，此有勝如、有差別謂後世也。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, These are four kinds: kṣatriyas, brahmins, householders, and artisans, which have superiority and distinctions that are called the afterlife.

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，若成就此五斷支，必得善師如來、無所著、正盡覺，
translation: These are of four kinds: the kṣatriya, brahmin, brāhmaṇa, vaiśya, and worker [castes]. If they accomplish these five factors of nirvana, they will surely attain the quality of having a good teacher who is a tathāgata, free from attachment, perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 必得可意，無不可意，亦於長夜得義饒益，安隱快樂。
translation: They will surely attain what’s agreeable and not what’s disagreeable, and for a long time they’ll also attain meaningful benefits and be peaceful and happy.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子信著如來，根生定立，無能奪者，謂沙門、梵志、天及魔、梵及餘世間，
translation: Well-versed noble disciples believe in the Tathāgata. Their faculties give rise to samdhi, and there is nothing that can snatch them away: śramaṇas, brāhmaṇas, brahmins, gods, Māras, Brahmās, and other worldlings.

source_sentence: 是謂第一斷支。
translation: This is called the first branch of cessation.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子少病無病，成就等食道，不熱不冷，正樂不諍，謂食飲消、正安隱消，
translation: Well-versed noble disciples have few illnesses and no illnesses, accomplish the path of equal food that’s neither hot nor cold, and are rightly blissful and not hungry. That is to say, they eat, drink, digest, and extinguish in right peace.

source_sentence: 是謂第二斷支。
translation: This is the second branch of cessation.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子無諂無誑、質直，現如真世尊及諸梵行，是謂第三斷支。
translation: The well-versed noble disciple who is neither flattering nor deceitful, straightforward and honest, the Bhagavān and his religious practices are as they really are. This is the third kind of relinquishment.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子常行精進，斷惡不善，修諸善法，恒自起意，專一堅固，為諸善本，
translation: Well-versed noble disciples always practice with energy, abandoning evil and unwholesome. Cultivating wholesome states, they constantly generate their own minds to concentrate on one single firmness as the foundation of wholesomeness.

source_sentence: 不捨方便，是謂第四斷支。
translation: The method of not abandoning is the fourth branch of cessation.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子修行智慧，觀興衰法，得如此智，聖慧明達，分別曉了，以正盡苦，
translation: Well-versed holy disciples cultivate wisdom and contemplate the rise and fall of phenomena. They attain this kind of wisdom. Their noble wisdom penetrates, discerns, and comprehends in order to correctly extinguish suffering.

source_sentence: 我見一沙門梵志聰明智慧，自稱聰明智慧，博聞決定，諳識諸經，制伏強敵，
translation: I see a renunciant or brahmin who is intelligent and wise, claiming to be intelligent and wise. He is learned and decisive, well versed in all the scriptures, and able to vanquish strong enemies.

source_sentence: 談論覺了，名德流布，一切世間無不聞知，所遊至處壞諸見宗，輙自立論，
translation: Their discussions are enlightened, and their fame and virtue spread. All the people in all worlds hear and know about them. Wherever they go, they destroy doctrines of views and arrogantly formulate their own theories.

source_sentence: 而作是說：『我等往至沙門瞿曇所，問如是如是事，若能答者，當難詰彼；
translation: They said, “We approached the śramaṇa Gautama and asked him questions such-and-such questions. If he answered in this way, it would be difficult for us to question him.

source_sentence: 若不能答，亦難詰已，捨之而去。』
translation: If they can't answer, it's also difficult to interrogate them and abandon them and leave.'

source_sentence: 彼聞世尊遊某村邑，往至佛所，問世尊事，世尊為答。
translation: When he heard that the Bhagavān had traveled to a certain village or town, he went to the Buddha and asked him about his affairs, and the Bhagavān answered.

source_sentence: 彼聞答已，便得歡喜，即從世尊求出家學，而受具足，得比丘法，佛便度彼而授具足，
translation: Having heard this reply, the bhikṣu was delighted. He immediately asked the World-honored One to allow him to renounce domestic life and study under him; he received his ordination and became fully ordained. Having thus attained the bhikṣu’s path, the Buddha liberated [the bhikṣu] from that worldly status and entrusted him with full ordination

source_sentence: 得比丘法。
translation: He attained the monk's teaching.

source_sentence: 「若彼諸尊出家學道而受具足，得比丘法已，獨住遠離，心無放逸，修行精勤。
translation: “Suppose those venerable monks leave home to train in the path and are fully ordained, and after they attain the monk’s precepts, they abide alone and seclusion, their minds without laxity, and practice diligently.

source_sentence: 彼獨住遠離，心無放逸，修行精勤已，若族姓子所為，剃除鬚髮，著袈裟衣，
translation: If a clansman shaves his hair and beard, dons the yellow robe, and puts on the white clothes of a monk who lives alone in seclusion, he is not negligent.

source_sentence: 至信、捨家、無家、學道者，唯無上梵行訖，於現法中自知自覺，自作證成就遊，
translation: Only those who have faith, renounce the householder’s life, go forth without a home, and study the path—only after having undertaken the practice of unexcelled celibacy do they know and awaken to themselves in the present life. They make their own determination and dwell having perfected it.

source_sentence: 生已盡，梵行已立，所作已辦，不更受有，知如真。
translation: They know it as it really is: birth has ended, the holy life has been established, what was to be done has been done. They will no longer experience existence.

source_sentence: 若彼諸尊知法已，乃至得阿羅訶，得阿羅訶已，便作是念：『諸賢！
translation: If those venerables know the teaching, they'll attain arhatship and after attaining arhatship, they'll think, 'Dear friends!

source_sentence: 我本幾了幾失？
translation: How much did I originally understand and how many errors did I make?

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我本非沙門稱沙門，非梵行稱梵行，非阿羅訶稱阿羅訶，我等今是沙門，
translation: I formerly did not call myself a śramaṇa but rather a śramaṇa. My practice of austerity is called my practice of austerity. If I were not an arhat, I would have called myself an arhat.

source_sentence: 是梵行，是阿羅訶。』
translation: This is religious practice, and this is arhatship.'

source_sentence: 是謂我於佛而有法靖。
translation: This is called saying that I have Dharma quiescence in the Buddha.

source_sentence: 因此故，我作是念：『如來、無所著、正盡覺所說法善，世尊弟子眾善趣向也。』
translation: Because of this, I think, 'The Tathāgata, Arhatless, and Perfectly Enlightened One who teaches the Dharma well is the Bhagavān's disciple with many good destinies.'

source_sentence: 「復次，世尊！
translation: “Furthermore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我自若居國，無過者令殺，有過者令殺，然在都坐，我故不得作如是說：『卿等並住，
translation: If I live in my own country, I will kill those who are not guilty. Those who are guilty I will kill. But while sitting in the capital, I cannot make such a proclamation:

source_sentence: 無人問卿事，人問我事，卿等不能斷此事，我能斷此事。』
translation: No one asks about your affairs, and someone asks about my affairs; you can't stop this matter, but I can stop this matter.'

source_sentence: 於其中間競論餘事，不待前論訖，我數見世尊大眾圍繞說法，彼中一人鼾眠作聲，
translation: I often saw the World-honored One, surrounded by a great assembly of bhikṣus, preaching the Dharma to them. There one of them slept soundlessly and cried out in sleep.

source_sentence: 有人語彼：『君莫鼾眠作聲，君不用聞世尊說法如甘露耶？』
translation: Someone says to them, 'Don't sleep and make sounds; don't you need to hear the Bhagavān teach like ambrosia?'

source_sentence: 彼人聞已，即便默然。
translation: After hearing this, the man remained silent.

source_sentence: 我作是念：『如來、無所著、正盡覺、眾調御士，甚奇！
translation: I thought, 'The Tathāgata, Arhatless, Perfectly Enlightened One, and the tamer of all sentient beings are most wonderful!'

source_sentence: 甚特！
translation: That's extraordinary!

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以無刀杖，皆自如法，安隱快樂。』
translation: Because there's no sword or stick, they all follow the rules themselves and are comfortable and happy.'

source_sentence: 是謂我於佛而有法靖。
translation: This is called saying that I have Dharma quiescence in the Buddha.

source_sentence: 因此故，我作是念：『如來、無所著、正盡覺所說法善，世尊弟子眾善趣向也。』
translation: Because of this, I think, 'The Tathāgata, Arhatless, and Perfectly Enlightened One who teaches the Dharma well is the Bhagavān's disciple with many good destinies.'

source_sentence: 「復次，世尊！
translation: “Furthermore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於仙餘及宿舊二臣出錢財賜，亦常稱譽，彼命由我，然不能令彼仙餘及宿舊二臣下意恭敬、尊重、供養、奉事於我，
translation: I gave money and property to the ṛṣi and his two former ministers, and they always praised me. Their order came from me, but I couldn’t get them to pay respect, reverence, honor, make offerings, and serve me with affection.

source_sentence: 如為世尊下意恭敬、尊重、供養、奉事也，是謂我於佛而有法靖。
translation: As the Bhagavān respects, venerates, honors, makes offerings, and serves them with his mind, this is called saying that I have a Dharma tranquility in regard to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 因此故，我作是念：『如來、無所著、正盡覺所說法善，世尊弟子眾善趣向也。』
translation: Because of this, I think, 'The Tathāgata, Arhatless, and Perfectly Enlightened One who teaches the Dharma well is the Bhagavān's disciple with many good destinies.'

source_sentence: 「復次，世尊！
translation: “Furthermore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我昔出仙，宿一小屋中，欲試仙餘、宿舊二臣，知彼頭向何處眠耶？
translation: Formerly I came out of the sage and spent the night in a small room. Wishing to test the other members of the holy man’s supernatural power, as well as the two old attendants of the constellation, do you know where they sleep?

source_sentence: 為向我，為向世尊？
translation: Is it directed toward me or the Bhagavān?

source_sentence: 於是，仙餘、宿舊二臣則於初夜結跏趺坐，默然燕坐，至中夜聞世尊在某方處，
translation: Then, in the first watch of the night, the ṛṣi and the two former ministers sat cross-legged. They sat quietly in meditation. In the middle watch of the night they heard that the World-honored One was staying at a certain place.

source_sentence: 便以頭向彼，以足向我。
translation: He then faced them with his head and feet and faced me with his feet.

source_sentence: 我見已，作是念：『此仙餘及宿舊二臣不在現勝事，是故彼不下意恭敬、尊重、供養、奉事於我，
translation: Having seen this, I thought: This holy man and the two former ministers are not engaged in meritorious deeds. For this reason they have no intention of honoring, venerating, honoring, supporting, or serving me.

source_sentence: 如為世尊下意恭敬、尊重、供養、奉事也。』
translation: Thus, the Bhagavān's intention is to respect, venerate, make offerings, and serve him.'

source_sentence: 是謂我於佛而有法靖。
translation: This is called saying that I have Dharma quiescence in the Buddha.

source_sentence: 因此故，我作是念：『如來、無所著、正盡覺所說法善，世尊弟子眾善趣向也。』
translation: Because of this, I think, 'The Tathāgata, Arhatless, and Perfectly Enlightened One who teaches the Dharma well is the Bhagavān's disciple with many good destinies.'

source_sentence: 「復次，世尊！
translation: “Furthermore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我亦國王，世尊亦法王，我亦剎利，世尊亦剎利，我亦拘薩羅，世尊亦拘薩羅，
translation: World-honored One, I am also a khattiya king. The World-honored One is also a khattiya king. The World-honored One is also a khattiya king.

source_sentence: 我年八十，世尊亦八十。
translation: I am eighty years old, and the World-honored One is also eighty years old.

source_sentence: 世尊以此事故，我堪耐為世尊盡形壽，下意恭敬、尊重、供養、奉事。
translation: Bhagavān, because of this matter, I'm able to endure for the rest of my life as Bhagavān, and I humbly respect, venerate, honor, offer support, and serve him.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今多事，欲還請辭。」
translation: Now, I have a lot of business to attend to, so I want to return and ask permission to leave.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Great king!

source_sentence: 自知時。」
translation: When you know for yourself.

source_sentence: 於是，拘薩羅王波斯匿聞佛所說，善受持誦，即從坐起，稽首佛足，繞三匝而去。
translation: Then King Prasenajit of Kośala, having heard the Buddha’s exhortation, accepted and remembered it well. He rose from his seat, paid homage at the Buddha’s feet, circumambulated him three times, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者阿難住世尊後，執拂侍佛。
translation: At the time, Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Bhagavān, holding a whisk in his hand to attend the Buddha.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊迴顧告曰：「阿難！
translation: The Bhagavān then looked back and told him, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有比丘依彌婁離林住者，令彼一切集在講堂。」
translation: Suppose there's a monk who lives in the forest of Miliṇḍa and causes all of them to gather in the lecture hall.

source_sentence: 於是，尊者阿難受佛教已，若諸比丘依彌婁離林住者，令彼一切集在講堂，
translation: Then, having received the Buddha’s discourse, Venerable Ānanda, if all the monks were living in the forest of Miliṇḍalī, he would cause them all to assemble in the assembly hall.

source_sentence: 還詣佛所，白曰：「世尊！
translation: He returned to the Buddha and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有比丘依彌婁離林住者，彼一切已集講堂，唯願世尊自當知時。」
translation: If there are monks who live in the forest of Miliṇḍa, they've all gathered in the lecture hall, so please let the Bhagavān know for himself when they do so.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊將尊者阿難往至講堂比丘眾前，敷座而坐，告曰：「比丘！
translation: Then the World-honored One took Venerable Ānanda to the assembly hall, sat cross-legged in front of the assembly of monks, and said:

source_sentence: 今拘薩羅王波斯匿在我前說此法莊嚴經已，即從座起，稽首我足，繞三匝而去。
translation: Now, King Prasenajit of Kośala, having taught this sutra on the adornment of the Dharma before me, rose from his seat, paid homage at my feet, circumambulated me three times, and departed.

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 汝等當受持此法莊嚴經，善誦善習。
translation: You should retain this sutra on the adornment of the Dharma, recite it well and practice it well.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 此法莊嚴經，如義如法，為梵行本，趣智趣覺，趣至涅槃。
translation: This Dharma Adorned Sutra, according to its meaning and according to the Dharma, is the foundation of religious practice, which leads to knowledge, wisdom, enlightenment, and nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 若族姓子至信、捨家、無家、學道者，亦當受持，當誦當習此法莊嚴經。」
translation: If a clansman reaches the stage of faith, abandons home, leaves homelessness, and trains in the path, he'll also accept and uphold it, recite it, and cultivate this Dharma-adorned sūtra.

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: The Buddha teaches thus.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and carried it out.

source_sentence: 法莊嚴經第二竟(三千三十七字)
translation: The Second Part of the Dharma Adorned Sutra (three thousand thirty-seven words)

source_sentence: （二一四）中阿含例品鞞訶提經第三(第五
translation: (2) The Third (Fifth) Chapter of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra

source_sentence: 後誦)
translation: (after recitation)

source_sentence: 我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta’s Grove in Sāvatthī.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者阿難住舍衛國，於東園鹿子母堂為小事故。
translation: At the time, Venerable Ānanda was staying at Sāvatthī in the Deer Mother Hall of the East Park because of a minor matter.

source_sentence: 彼時尊者阿難將一比丘從舍衛出，往至東園鹿子母堂，所為事訖，將彼比丘還，
translation: Venerable Ānanda then took a certain monk out of Sāvatthī and proceeded to the Deer’s Mother’s Hall in the eastern park. Having completed his duty, he led that monk home.

source_sentence: 往至勝林給孤獨園。
translation: He went to the Jeta Grove and gave it to Anāthapiṇḍada Park.

source_sentence: 爾時，拘薩羅王波斯匿乘一奔陀利象，與尸利阿荼大臣俱出舍衛國。
translation: It was then that the king of Kośala Prasenajit rode out of Sāvatthī in an elephant riding on a cuṇḍalī elephant, accompanied by his minister Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 尊者阿難遙見拘薩羅王波斯匿來已，問伴比丘：「彼是拘薩羅王波斯匿耶？」
translation: Venerable Ānanda saw King Prasenajit of Kośala coming from a distance and asked the companion monk, Is that King Prasenajit of Kośala?

source_sentence: 答曰：「是也。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 尊者阿難便下道避至一樹下。
translation: Venerable Ānanda then went down the road and fled to a tree.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿遙見尊者阿難在於樹間，問曰：「尸利阿荼！
translation: From a distance, King Prasenajit of Kośala saw Venerable Ānanda among the trees and asked, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 彼是沙門阿難耶？」
translation: Is that the ascetic Ānanda?

source_sentence: 尸利阿荼答曰：「是也。」
translation: Śāriputra replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿告尸利阿荼大臣曰：「汝御此象，令至沙門阿難所。」
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit told the minister Śāriputra, Take control of this elephant and send it to the ascetic Ānanda.

source_sentence: 尸利阿荼受王教已即御此象，令至尊者阿難所。
translation: After receiving the king's instruction, Śāriputra tamed this elephant and sent it to Venerable Ānanda.

source_sentence: 於是，拘薩羅王波斯匿問曰：「阿難！
translation: Then the king of Kośala Prasenajit asked, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 從何處來，欲至何處？」
translation: Where did you come from and where do you want to go?

source_sentence: 尊者阿難答曰：「大王！
translation: Venerable Ānanda replied, Great king!

source_sentence: 我從東園鹿子母堂來，欲至勝林給孤獨園。」
translation: I came from the deer mother's hall in the eastern garden and wanted to go to the solitary park of Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta Grove.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿語曰：「阿難！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit said, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若於勝林無急事者，可共往至阿夷羅婆提河，為慈愍故。」
translation: If there's no urgent matter in the superior forest, they can go together to the Ajiravatī River for the sake of kindness.

source_sentence: 尊者阿難為拘薩羅王波斯匿默然而受。
translation: Venerable Ānanda accepted it quietly for the sake of King Prasenajit of Kośala.

source_sentence: 於是，拘薩羅王波斯匿令尊者阿難在前，共至阿夷羅婆提河。
translation: Thereupon, the king of Kośala Prasenajit ordered Venerable Ānanda to be in front of him and they went together to the Ajiravatī River.

source_sentence: 到已下乘，取彼象薦，四疊敷地，請尊者阿難：「阿難！
translation: When he arrived, he descended and took the elephant's recommendation, spread it in four layers on the ground, and asked Venerable Ānanda, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 可坐此座。」
translation: You can sit here at this seat.

source_sentence: 尊者阿難答曰：「止！
translation: Venerable Ānanda replied, Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Don't!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 但心靖足。」
translation: He simply calms his mind and feet.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿再三請尊者阿難：「阿難！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit repeatedly asked Venerable Ānanda, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 可坐此座。」
translation: You can sit here at this seat.

source_sentence: 尊者阿難亦再三語：「止！
translation: Venerable Ānanda also repeatedly said, Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Don't!

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 但心靖足，我自有尼師檀，我今當坐。」
translation: But my mind is still at my feet, and I have a nun's sandalwood; now I will sit there.

source_sentence: 於是，尊者阿難敷尼師檀，結跏趺坐。
translation: Then Venerable Ānanda spread out his sitting mat and sat cross-legged on it.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿與尊者阿難共相問訊，却坐一面，語曰：「阿難！
translation: King Prasenajit of Kośala and Venerable Ānanda exchanged greetings, withdrew to sit at one side, and said, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 欲有所問，聽我問耶？」
translation: Do you want to ask something, and will you listen to my questions?

source_sentence: 尊者阿難答曰：「大王！
translation: Venerable Ānanda replied, Great king!

source_sentence: 欲問便問，我問已當思。」
translation: If you want to ask a question, ask it; I'll consider it after asking it.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿問曰：「阿難！
translation: King Prasenajit of Kośala asked, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如來頗行如是身行，謂此身行為沙門、梵志所憎惡耶？」
translation: Could it be that the Tathāgata practices such bodily actions, meaning that this bodily action is abhorred by ascetics and priests?

source_sentence: 尊者阿難答曰：「大王！
translation: Venerable Ānanda replied, Great king!

source_sentence: 如來不行如是身行，謂此身行為沙門、梵志聰明智慧及餘世間所憎惡也。」
translation: The Tathāgata doesn't practice such bodily actions, which are the physical actions of ascetics, priests, brahmins, intelligent and wise people, and other worldly things that are hateful.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，歎曰：「善哉！
translation: After hearing this, the king of Kośala Prasenajit praised it, saying, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我所不及，若聰明智慧及餘世間者，而阿難及之。
translation: If he were as intelligent and wise as the rest of the world, Ānanda wouldn't be able to match him.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有不善相悉而毀呰稱譽者，我等不見彼真實也。
translation: If someone disparages and praises unwholesome characteristics, we won't see them as real.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有善相悉而毀呰稱譽者，我見彼真實也。
translation: If someone has good characteristics that are fully present and disparages and praises them, I'll see their reality.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如來頗行如是身行，謂此身行為沙門、梵志聰明智慧及餘世間所憎惡耶？」
translation: Could it be that the Tathāgata thus conducts himself in body actions, meaning that this body conduct of ascetics, priests, intelligent and wise people, and other worldly beings are hateful?

source_sentence: 尊者阿難答曰：「大王！

translation: With internal perceptions of form, they perceive form and external form, measureless good form and bad form, and those forms that are removed by knowing and removed by seeing make this kind of perception: 'This is called the second removal.'

source_sentence: 復次，比丘！

source_sentence: 復次，比丘！

source_sentence: 「復次，比丘！

source_sentence: 彼色除已知、除已見，作如是想：『是謂第五除處。』

translation: Again, if someone cultivates drowsiness without getting tired of it at first, this is called a monk who, if someone cultivates these three things, doesn't get tired of them at first and can't reach the point of cessation.

translation: In this case, if there is the swiftness of abandoning unsatisfactoriness, it is due to the swiftness of abandoning unsatisfactoriness. This abandoning is not widespread and does not spread; even gods and humans do not call it widespread.

translation: How can I stop spreading it widely, even to the point where gods and humans are also called spreading it?

source_sentence: 謂八支正道，正見乃至正定為八，是謂我斷廣布流布，乃至天人亦稱廣布。
translation: It means the eightfold right path, from right view to right concentration—eight [factors]. This is reckoned to be self-abandonment and widespread dissemination, up to gods and humans, which are also called widespread dissemination.

source_sentence: 我如是，諸沙門、梵志虛偽妄言，不善不真，實誣謗於我，彼實有眾生施設斷壞，
translation: World-Honored One, I am like this. The śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas falsely asserted that which is neither good nor true but in fact slanders me. Those truly are sentient beings who posit annihilation or disintegration.

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇無所施設，彼實有眾生施設斷壞。
translation: The renunciant Gotama does not posit anything. In fact, there are living beings among them who posit annihilation or destruction.

source_sentence: 若此無我不如是說，彼如來於現法中斷知一切，得息、止、滅、涅槃。」
translation: If this selflessness isn't explained like that, then the Tathāgata will cut off all of them in the present life and attain cessation, cessation, cessation, and nirvāṇa.
